intro: Notopleura pacorana, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a fibrous, hollow stem covered in a layer of old leaf bases. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Notopleura pacorana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
